_header: Pilate was lither man & come of lither more
_description: Life of Pilate, in the South English Legendary

BodLauMis463.First Lines:
PIlatus was a luþer man & comen of luþer morebitwen a
                    king & a fol womman in spousebreche y bore…
BodLauMis463.Last Lines:
…Þus Pilatus ended his lif as he wel worthi wasGod shilde
                    eche Cristen man fro so deolful cas
BodLauMis463.Note: Two columns per page, one full-line, the other half-line.

BodTan17.First Lines:
PIlatus was a liþer man & cam of liþer moreBe twen a
                    king & a fol womman in spouse breke I bore…
BodTan17.Last Lines:
…þus pilatus endid his liif as he wel worþi wasGod
                    schilde euery cristen man fro so dolful a cas

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Pilatus was a luþer man & cam of luþer moreBitwene a
                    kyng & a fol womman in spous bruche i bore…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…Þus pilatus endede his lyf as he wel worþi wasGod
                    schilde vche cristene man from so deolful cas. Amen
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BodAddC220.First Lines:
…for þe en queste up hym seyde þat he destruede here
                lawe& þe lawe ȝaf þat suche alle me scholde bryng of
                dawe& y þat þere Iustise was þorw þyn heste &
                redeMoste nede dom ȝyve þane wane þe queste hit
                sede…
BodAddC220.Last Lines:
…þus pylatus endede his lyf as wel worþy wasGod schilde
                eueryche cristene man fram suche a delful cas
BodAddC220.Note:
Lines 1-195 wanting. In the upper right corner of f. 21:
                ‘Pylatus’.

OxfTri57.First Lines:
Pilatus was a luþer man and com of luþer moreBy twene a kyng
                and a fol woman in spousebreche was y bore…
OxfTri57.Last Lines:
…þus Pilatus endyde his lyf as he wel worþy wasGod
                schylde ech cristene man from þe delful cas

CamCCC145.First Lines:
Pylate was a luþer man & com of luþere moreBitwene a kyng
                and a fol womman in spousbruche was ibore…
CamCCC145.Last Lines:
…Ac he bycom þer afterward in greet meseyre & strongHys
                fleyȝs bygan to breke al out & rotede & foule stong
CamCCC145.Editions:
D’Evelyn,  Charlotte,  and  A. J. Mill, eds.  
             The South English Legendary: Corpus Christi College Cambridge MS. 145
                and British Museum MS. Harley 2277, with variants from Bodley MS. Ashmole 43 and
                British Museum MS. Cotton Julius D.ix.
EETS
         o.s. 235 (1959), 236 (1956); repr. 1967: 2.697.

CamKC13.First Lines:
Pilatus was a luþer man and come of a luþer moreBi twene a
                kyng and a fool womman in spousbruche he was y bore…
CamKC13.Last Lines:
…Þus pilatus endede his lif as ȝe wel worþi wasOure
                lord schulde ech cristen man fram so deolfole cas

CamMagPep2344.First Lines:
Pilatus was a luþer man and com of a luþer moreBy twene a
                kyng and a ffol womman in spousbruche ybore…
CamMagPep2344.Last Lines:
…Þus Pilatus endede his lif as he wel worþi wasGod
                shulde ech cristene man ffram so deolffol cas

CamStJohn28.First Lines:
Pilat was a luþer man & comyn of a luþer morebe twen a
                kyng & a fol woman in spousebreche was bore…
CamStJohn28.Last Lines:
…þus Pilat ended his lyf as he wel wurþi wasgod schelde
                euery cristen man fro þat cursede cas
CamStJohn28.Note: In this MS incorporated as part of 3452.

CamTCC605.First Lines:
Pilatus was a luþer man ycom of luþer noreby twene a king
                & a foule womman in spousebreche ybore…
CamTCC605.Last Lines:
…Þus pilatus endede his lif as he worþy wasGod schulde
                eche cristen man fram suche delful cas

BLEge2891.First Lines: [    ]us was a luþer man and com of is luþer more[   ]yt wene a kyng and a foul womman in spousbruche ibore…
BLEge2891.Last Lines: …þus pilate ended is lif as he wel worþe wasGod ssulde ech cristenman fram so deoluol cas
BLEge2891.Note: Beginnings of first 11 lines on f. 59v lost due to damage to leaf.
